subject: performance information in TestResult
msgSnippet: I was wondering if anybody has used junit to report results that do not take the form pass / fail ?  My immediate need is to report performance information:
messageBody:
I was wondering if anybody has used junit to report results that do
not take the form "pass"/"fail"? My immediate need is to report
performance information: time of execution.

I think that this information is of general importance. I was
convinced after hearing anecdote Cem Kaner told about some tests that
are run at Oracle. The essential idea is any dramatic change in
performance (faster or slower) behaviour warrants investigation, even
if [especially if] other test assertions fail to locate a specific
problem.

I did some poking around on the web. The google search "junit
performance testresult" uncovered a couple references on netbeans.org.
Otherwise, nothing exciting.

I could also use a couple good references to successful attempts at
extending TestResult. I only need some hints about passing the
information around. I will of course tailor the contents to suit the
task I have in mind.
